subject: RE: [junit] Using the same test but with different parameters
msgSnippet: So said  Dinwiddie, George  on  2002-11-13 ... Beautiful. J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s write software that people understand.
messageBody:
So said Dinwiddie, George on 2002-11-13

>mark_x_robinson asked:
>> I have a standard test with needs to be run for different parameters.
>> I have created an XML file to define all the parameters and was
>> hoping to use JUnit to run the tests.
>>
>> I cannot see how I can run the same method using different
>> parameters. e.g tests cannot take paramters and methods are
>> only called one.
>
>How about something like this:
>
> ...
> doTestWithParameter(Parameter parm) {
> ...
> assertTrue(something);
> }
>
> void testParm1() {
> doTestWithParameter(new Parameter(1));
> }
>
> void testParm2() {
> doTestWithParameter(new Parameter(2));
> }
> ...

Beautiful.

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
